articles.title: Individual-based modeling with NetLogoR
articles.contents:
Who: Sarah Bauduin, Olivier Gimenez, Oksana Grente, Nina Santostasi
When: June 21-22, 2021
Where: Zoom
Timeline
Day 1
Getting familiar with individual-based models (IBMs)
Getting familiar with NetLogoR
Understanding simple models coded in NetLogoR

Day 2
Understanding more complex models coded in NetLogoR
Debugging IBMs
Parameterizing IBMs
Publishing IBMs
Coding on your own

Requirements
Install R and RStudio
Install the following R packages: NetLogoR, testthat. You can install them all at once by running the following code in the R command line:


install.packages(c("NetLogoR", "testthat"))



You need to be familiar with R. This workshop is not about learning how to code on R but how to use an R package in particular. For example, you need to be familiar with for loops and how to create function (even if they are very simple ones).
For any help before or after the workshop
Sarah Bauduin: sarah.bauduin@ofb.gouv.fr
